definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: In classroom, students are reward or punish by teachers.
sentences.chinese: 課堂賞罰施動者是教師，而受動者是學生。

sentences.english: I was obliged to confess, and in recompense for my cowardice and inhumanity was sent out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 作爲對我的懦弱和不友好的賞罰，我被趕出了房子。

sentences.english: The establishment of military rewards and punishments regulation provided guarantee to improve battle effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 而軍事賞罰的實行也爲提高軍隊戰鬥力提供了保障。

sentences.english: Anyone who breaks the law shall be punished .
sentences.chinese: 無論誰犯了法都將受到賞罰。

sentences.english: Last principle is to be decisive and strict in giving out rewards and administering punishments.
sentences.chinese: 第四，是嚴格執行賞罰，使官兵不敢渙散而有信用。

sentences.english: Justice was meted out to them.
sentences.chinese: 他們受到了公平的賞罰。

sentences.english: Rewards and punishment system is fair and transparent and is implemented in a timely fashion.
sentences.chinese: 第三是，賞罰分明，執行賞罰適得其時。
